definition: reinsurance (contractual device spreading risk between insurers)
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

sentences.english: The premium rate of disproportional reinsurance by bilateral party agreed.
sentences.chinese: 非比例再保险的保险费率由双方当事人议定。

sentences.english: When a reinsurer purchases reinsurance, we call it retrocession.
sentences.chinese: 当再保险人购买再保险时，我们称为转分保。

sentences.english: Reinsurance, like the original insurance, is regulated in different degrees by every country.
sentences.chinese: 再保险同原保险一样，受到各国政府不同程度的监管。

sentences.english: Some liabilities will, however, have been reinsured through the London market.
sentences.chinese: 但一些理赔责任已通过伦敦市场进行了再保险。

sentences.english: The Global Index Reinsurance Facility targets farmers and agrarian communities among other beneficiaries.
sentences.chinese: 全球指数再保险基金的受益人包括农民和农业社区。

sentences.english: No significant difference exists between domestic and foreign insurers.
sentences.chinese: 中外资保险公司在再保险需求上并无显著差异。

definition: life insurance/abbr. for 人壽保險|人寿保险
China Insurance Regulatory Commission (CIRC), abbr. for 中國保險監督管理委員會|中国保险监督管理委员会[Zhong1 guo2 Bao3 xian3 Jian1 du1 Guan3 li3 Wei3 yuan2 hui4]

pinyin: Mei3 guo2 Guo2 ji4 Ji2 tuan2
jin1 rong2 yan3 sheng1 chan3 pin3
